did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Correspondence, research, articles, course material and lectures pertaining to Dr. Smith's study of Japan.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Professor of Anthropology and Asian Studies, Cornell University.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes articles and information about Japanese emperors, ancestor worship, the Japanese in Brazil, historical demography and material concerning the student protests at Cornell in 1969, correspondence with David Nathan Meyerson, and scrapbooks with newspaper clippings from World War I and World War II, material concerning Smith's participation in the Army Specialized Training Reserve Program and programs from various plays from the 1940s.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Robert J. Smith Papers, #14-25-3175. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

arrangement.head: COLLECTION ARRANGEMENT
arrangement.p: Arranged by subject.

Series XVII. Army Specialized Training Reserve Program (ASTRP)
Box 37
Box 45

This material covers the years from Robert Smith's enlistment in the US Army Reserve in July 1944 to his service in the occupation of Japan in 1946. In the Army Specialized Training Reserve Program (ASTRP) and Army Specialized Training Program (ASTP) at Carnegie Tech, University of Minnesota and Yale University

Series XVIII. David Meyerson Material

Series XIX. The W.W. Curtis Ainu Collection
Box 43 Folders 1-7

Series XX. Other Material
Boxes 37-38
Box 44

Series XXI. Suye-Mura Material
Boxes 46-47

Series XVII. Army Specialized Training Reserve Program (ASTRP)

scopecontent.p: These materials cover the years from Robert Smith's enlistment in the US Army Reserve in July 1944 to his service in the occupation of Japan in 1946. In the Army Specialized Training Reserve Program (ASTRP) and Army Specialized Training Program (ASTP) at Carnegie Tech, University of Minnesota and Yale University.

Wiswell/Smith Correspondence & Ella L. Wiswell Obituary

The following folders contain Ella L. Wiswell's correspondence with a variety of individuals and institutions. Most of the correspondence concerns the 1935-1936 study of the Japanese village of Suye Mura conducted with her first husband John Fee Embree and her subsequent visits there in 1951 (following his death in 1950) and 1968 and 1985 with her second husband Frederic Wiswell.
Reviews and Correspondence re: The Women of Suye Mura
Kawamura Nozomu- Correspondence (Translator of The Women of Suye Mura)
Ushijima Morimitsu-Correspondence (Long time student of Suye Mura in the postwar period)
Nishino Keisuke- Correspondence (Resident of Suye Mura and sponsor of 1985 celebration in Suye Mura. See much additional material.)
Shirahama Tamotsu- Correspondence (Resident of Suye Mura.)
Rudolf Janssen- Correspondence re: his paper on Occupation of Japan.
Bulletin of Concerned Asia Scholars-Correspondence re: offensive issue.
Miscellaneous items concerning John Fee Embree following his death in 1950.
First postwar visit to Suye Mura by Ella Lury Embree
Second postwar visit to Suye Mura by Ella Lury and Fredric Wiswell
Two Japanese Editions of Suye Mura: A Japanese Village by John F. Embree
Ella Wiswell-Miscellaneous lectures on Japanese Women
50th Anniversary visit to Suye Mura by Ella Lury and Frederic Wiswell #1
50th Anniversary visit to Suye Mura by Ella Lury and Frederic Wiswell #2
50th Anniversary visit to Suye Mura by Ella Lury and Frederic Wiswell #3
Brochures- Suye Mura, Hitoyoshi Town, Kumamoto Prefecture
Photograph album pages of Wiswells visit to Suye Mura
Wiswell/Smith Interview by David Plath, Honolulu, Hawaii I&II
